definition: who would have thought that/who would have expected that

sentences.english: Bring people up who witness stirring.
sentences.chinese: 谁料证人带人上来围搅。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, my daughters like it even better, as it is easier to chew and more crispy.
sentences.chinese: 谁料女儿更喜欢，说更易咀嚼，更松化可口。

sentences.english: To his surprise the beast rose up with a roar of glee.
sentences.chinese: 谁料那巨兽欢快地吼叫着站起身来。

sentences.english: He took dogs and babies for walks, cleared out cupboards, and mended books.
sentences.chinese: 他带着狗散步，清除了碗柜，谁料书和婴儿。

sentences.english: Kingdom barriss to sister for justice, be JiYaSha shamed.
sentences.chinese: 芭丽去为妹妹讨公道，谁料被吉雅莎羞辱。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, he misses his step and falls into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 谁料，他一脚踩空，落进了陷阱里。

definition: who would have thought that/who would have expected that
who would have thought?/who could have imagined?/unexpectedly
unexpectedly/actually/to go so far as to/indeed
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
to be just about to/to be on the point of
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/in spite of everything/in that crazy way/actually/to go as far as to
too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it
